intro: Jaltomata bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored jaltomata, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its distinctive two-toned flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers feature a striking contrast between white and purple petals. Jaltomata bicolor is often found in clusters, with each flower blooming in late spring to early summer.
